      • testServiceNotificationsUnregisterDuringCallback

        public void testServiceNotificationsUnregisterDuringCallback()
                                                      throws Throwable
        This test uses a service listener that unregisters itself during the callbacks. This a test that verifies the concurrency logic on the listener management code, that it doesn't throw any immutable state change exceptions if you change list membership during the notifications. The standard AbstractService implementation copies the list to an array in a synchronized block then iterates through the copy precisely to prevent this problem.
        Throws:
        Throwable - on a failure
